elements.text:
The sspr() function draws a sprite to
a given screen transform, stretching if
necessary.

sspr(
  src -- source sprite
  x0 -- left boundary
  y0 -- top boundary of sprite
  w0 -- width from x0
  h0 -- height from y0
  x1 -- left boundary of target
  y1 -- top boundary of target
  [w1] -- width from x1 (default: w0)
  [h1] -- height from y1 (default: h0)
)

The first 5 values relate to what you intend
to draw (sprite); the last 4 define where on
the screen to draw.

Passing a sprite width value greater
than the actual sprite size will pad
with empty space.
